article_title: GM Korea Unit Agrees to Raise Employee Wages
article_text:
SEOUL—General Motors Co.'s South Korean unit said Monday it had tentatively agreed on new wage terms for the year with its labor union, potentially averting a strike.

GM Korea, whose factories provide approximately one-fifth of GM's global manufacturing output, said in a statement the company agreed to raise employees' basic monthly salary by 63,000 won ($61) and provide an annual bonus of 10.5 million ($10,200) won a person. The...

article_metadata.author: Min-Jeong Lee
article_metadata.article.origheadline: GM Korea Unit Agrees to Wage Increase

article_summary:
SEOUL—General Motors Co.'s South Korean unit said Monday it had tentatively agreed on new wage terms for the year with its labor union, potentially averting a strike.
GM Korea, whose factories provide approximately one-fifth of GM's global manufacturing output, said in a statement the company agreed to raise employees' basic monthly salary by 63,000 won ($61) and provide an annual bonus of 10.5 million ($10,200) won a person.
